info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued April 2 at 10:23AM AKDT until April 5 at 1:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage AK
info.description:
* WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. Visibilities may be reduced to as low as one quarter mile.
* WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta Coast from Kipnuk north including Nunivak Island.
* WHEN...From late tonight through Saturday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...Visibilities reduced to one quarter mile or less due to blowing snow. Travel could be very difficult.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and gusty winds will develop along a frontal boundary moving east to west across the Kuskokwim Delta beginning early Thursday morning. The heaviest snowfall rates and strongest winds are expected Thursday evening through Friday. Snow and gusty winds will taper off beginning late Friday from south to north along the coast as the front moves into the eastern Bering. Snow and blowing snow is also possible for communities south and east of Kipnuk. However, blizzard conditions are not expected for these locations.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Watch for blizzard conditions means there is a potential for falling and/or blowing snow with strong winds and extremely poor visibilities. This can lead to whiteout conditions and make travel very hazardous.

parameter.value: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Kuskokwim Delta Coast and Nunivak Island
